text: Solidago gypsophila is rare Mexican species of flowering plants in the sunflower family. It has been found in the state of Coahuila in northeastern Mexico.Nesom, Guy L. 1989. Phytologia 67: 142-143Tropicos, Solidago hintoniorum G.L. Nesom Solidago gypsophila is a perennial herb up to 200 cm (80 inches) tall. Leaves are crowded together and generally originated vertically rather than horizontally, up to 7.5 cm (3 inches) long. Flower heads are yellow, in a large, branching, conical array at the tops of the stems. ==References== gypsophila Category:Flora of Coahuila Category:Plants described in 1989
title: Solidago gypsophila
